advertisement

Survey provides invaluable data on Pa PERIOD economy

Jack Malehorn uses it to get a good feel for Pennsylvanias economy PERIOD He said it is crucial for him as a staff economist at United Telephone SystemsEastern Group a state telephone utility based in Carlisle to completely understand what forces drive the economy PERIOD Because of this he added it is an invaluable reasource PERIOD

 Malehorn said PERIOD

The resource Malehorn referred to is the Pennsylvania Business Survey PERIOD The survey is published monthly by the Center for Regional Business Analysis part of the College of Business Administration and is distributed to  subscribers PERIOD

Bill Anderson assistant director of the center said the purpose of the survey is to provide an uptodate analysis of the Pennslyvania economy PERIOD

Anderson said the survey besides presenting a monthly analysis of the state economy as a whole includes four times each year an overview of the  major economic regions in the state PERIOD He said businesses often find the information in those surveys especially helpful for developing marketing programs PERIOD

The survey also periodically includes the results of recent research dealing with the state economy he said PERIOD

Anderson said the survey is the only source in the state that gathers so wide a variety of data adjusts and interprets these data and presents the information in a concise and easily accessible form PERIOD

He said the center compiles some of the information itself through agreements with state utilities to provide the center with certain data such as the sales of electricity for the month PERIOD Industrial groups and state and federal government agencies are the other sources of data he said PERIOD

While the data are quite reliable Anderson said there is always some error associated with most data PERIOD For example he said the employment figures complied by the state are based on a representitive survey of workingage people PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

However he added that because most sources have been gathering data for so long the figures are fairly accurate PERIOD

After the data is complied he said the center runs them through a varitey of statistical manipulations PERIOD These manipulations seasonally adjust the data  taking into account cyclic changes in the economy which occur throught the year such as the increase in sale during the holiday season PERIOD He said this adjustment yields a truer picture of the actual course of the economy PERIOD

 Anderson said PERIOD

Benatec Associates Inc. an arcitectural and engineering consulting firm based in Harrisburg finds the survey to be a very good indicator of economic trends said Jean Kraft human resources manager PERIOD

Kraft said Benatec uses the survey to determine the states general business climate and to locate areas with high growth and potential PERIOD This information is necessary for developing marketing programs PERIOD

Besides businesses all members of the state legislature and all state representatives to the Congress subscribe to the survey PERIOD

A business legislative assistant for for U.S PERIOD Sen PERIOD Arlen Specter RPa. bill Morley said the survey keeps the senator abreast of the states economy PERIOD

Anderson said financial support for the survey comes from the College of Business Administration and from subscribers who pay an anual fee of  PERIOD

In addition he said support comes from businesses that want to know more about specific economic problems and will subsidize research in those areas PERIOD
